4231     /* ------------------------ Size = 2 ------------------------ */
4232     
4233     static INLINE
4234     UWord mc_LOADV16 ( Addr a, Bool isBigEndian )
4235     {
4236        PROF_EVENT(240, "mc_LOADV16");
4237     
4238     #ifndef PERF_FAST_LOADV
4239        return (UWord)mc_LOADVn_slow( a, 16, isBigEndian );
4240     #else
4241        {
4242           UWord   sm_off, vabits8;
4243           SecMap* sm;
4244     
4245           if (UNLIKELY( UNALIGNED_OR_HIGH(a,16) )) {
4246              PROF_EVENT(241, "mc_LOADV16-slow1");
4247              return (UWord)mc_LOADVn_slow( a, 16, isBigEndian );
4248           }
4249     
4250           sm      = get_secmap_for_reading_low(a);
4251           sm_off  = SM_OFF(a);
4252           vabits8 = sm->vabits8[sm_off];
4253           // Handle common case quickly: a is suitably aligned, is mapped, and is
4254           // addressible.
4255           // Convert V bits from compact memory form to expanded register form
4256           if      (vabits8 == VA_BITS8_DEFINED  ) { return V_BITS16_DEFINED;   }
4257           else if (vabits8 == VA_BITS8_UNDEFINED) { return V_BITS16_UNDEFINED; }
4258           else {
4259              // The 4 (yes, 4) bytes are not all-defined or all-undefined, check
4260              // the two sub-bytes.
4261              UChar vabits4 = extract_vabits4_from_vabits8(a, vabits8);
4262              if      (vabits4 == VA_BITS4_DEFINED  ) { return V_BITS16_DEFINED;   }
4263              else if (vabits4 == VA_BITS4_UNDEFINED) { return V_BITS16_UNDEFINED; }
4264              else {
4265                 /* Slow case: the two bytes are not all-defined or all-undefined. */
4266                 PROF_EVENT(242, "mc_LOADV16-slow2");
4267                 return (UWord)mc_LOADVn_slow( a, 16, isBigEndian );
4268              }
4269           }
4270        }
4271     #endif
4272     }
4273     
4274     VG_REGPARM(1) UWord MC_(helperc_LOADV16be) ( Addr a )
4275     {
4276        return mc_LOADV16(a, True);
4277     }
4278     VG_REGPARM(1) UWord MC_(helperc_LOADV16le) ( Addr a )
4279     {
4280        return mc_LOADV16(a, False);
4281     }

4284     static INLINE
4285     void mc_STOREV16 ( Addr a, UWord vbits16, Bool isBigEndian )
4286     {
4287        PROF_EVENT(250, "mc_STOREV16");
4288     
4289     #ifndef PERF_FAST_STOREV
4290        mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 16, (ULong)vbits16, isBigEndian );
4291     #else
4292        {
4293           UWord   sm_off, vabits8;
4294           SecMap* sm;
4295     
4296           if (UNLIKELY( UNALIGNED_OR_HIGH(a,16) )) {
4297              PROF_EVENT(251, "mc_STOREV16-slow1");
4298              mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 16, (ULong)vbits16, isBigEndian );
4299              return;
4300           }
4301     
4302           sm      = get_secmap_for_reading_low(a);
4303           sm_off  = SM_OFF(a);
4304           vabits8 = sm->vabits8[sm_off];
4305           if (LIKELY( !is_distinguished_sm(sm) && 
4306                               (VA_BITS8_DEFINED   == vabits8 ||
4307                                VA_BITS8_UNDEFINED == vabits8) ))
4308           {
4309              /* Handle common case quickly: a is suitably aligned, */
4310              /* is mapped, and is addressible. */
4311              // Convert full V-bits in register to compact 2-bit form.
4312              if (V_BITS16_DEFINED == vbits16) {
4313                 insert_vabits4_into_vabits8( a, VA_BITS4_DEFINED ,
4314                                              &(sm->vabits8[sm_off]) );
4315              } else if (V_BITS16_UNDEFINED == vbits16) {
4316                 insert_vabits4_into_vabits8( a, VA_BITS4_UNDEFINED,
4317                                              &(sm->vabits8[sm_off]) );
4318              } else {
4319                 /* Slow but general case -- writing partially defined bytes. */
4320                 PROF_EVENT(252, "mc_STOREV16-slow2");
4321                 mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 16, (ULong)vbits16, isBigEndian );
4322              }
4323           } else {
4324              /* Slow but general case. */
4325              PROF_EVENT(253, "mc_STOREV16-slow3");
4326              mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 16, (ULong)vbits16, isBigEndian );
4327           }
4328        }
4329     #endif
4330     }

4333     {
4334        mc_STOREV16(a, vbits16, True);

4345     VG_REGPARM(1)
4346     UWord MC_(helperc_LOADV8) ( Addr a )
4347     {
4348        PROF_EVENT(260, "mc_LOADV8");
4349     
4350     #ifndef PERF_FAST_LOADV
4351        return (UWord)mc_LOADVn_slow( a, 8, False/*irrelevant*/ );
4352     #else
4353        {
4354           UWord   sm_off, vabits8;
4355           SecMap* sm;
4356     
4357           if (UNLIKELY( UNALIGNED_OR_HIGH(a,8) )) {
4358              PROF_EVENT(261, "mc_LOADV8-slow1");
4359              return (UWord)mc_LOADVn_slow( a, 8, False/*irrelevant*/ );
4360           }
4361     
4362           sm      = get_secmap_for_reading_low(a);
4363           sm_off  = SM_OFF(a);
4364           vabits8 = sm->vabits8[sm_off];
4365           // Convert V bits from compact memory form to expanded register form
4366           // Handle common case quickly: a is mapped, and the entire
4367           // word32 it lives in is addressible.
4368           if      (vabits8 == VA_BITS8_DEFINED  ) { return V_BITS8_DEFINED;   }
4369           else if (vabits8 == VA_BITS8_UNDEFINED) { return V_BITS8_UNDEFINED; }
4370           else {
4371              // The 4 (yes, 4) bytes are not all-defined or all-undefined, check
4372              // the single byte.
4373              UChar vabits2 = extract_vabits2_from_vabits8(a, vabits8);
4374              if      (vabits2 == VA_BITS2_DEFINED  ) { return V_BITS8_DEFINED;   }
4375              else if (vabits2 == VA_BITS2_UNDEFINED) { return V_BITS8_UNDEFINED; }
4376              else {
4377                 /* Slow case: the byte is not all-defined or all-undefined. */
4378                 PROF_EVENT(262, "mc_LOADV8-slow2");
4379                 return (UWord)mc_LOADVn_slow( a, 8, False/*irrelevant*/ );
4380              }
4381           }
4382        }
4383     #endif
4384     }
4385     
4386     
4387     VG_REGPARM(2)
4388     void MC_(helperc_STOREV8) ( Addr a, UWord vbits8 )
4389     {
4390        PROF_EVENT(270, "mc_STOREV8");
4391     
4392     #ifndef PERF_FAST_STOREV
4393        mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 8, (ULong)vbits8, False/*irrelevant*/ );
4394     #else
4395        {
4396           UWord   sm_off, vabits8;
4397           SecMap* sm;
4398     
4399           if (UNLIKELY( UNALIGNED_OR_HIGH(a,8) )) {
4400              PROF_EVENT(271, "mc_STOREV8-slow1");
4401              mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 8, (ULong)vbits8, False/*irrelevant*/ );
4402              return;
4403           }
4404     
4405           sm      = get_secmap_for_reading_low(a);
4406           sm_off  = SM_OFF(a);
4407           vabits8 = sm->vabits8[sm_off];
4408           if (LIKELY
4409                 ( !is_distinguished_sm(sm) &&
4410                   ( (VA_BITS8_DEFINED == vabits8 || VA_BITS8_UNDEFINED == vabits8)
4411                  || (VA_BITS2_NOACCESS != extract_vabits2_from_vabits8(a, vabits8))
4412                   )
4413                 )
4414              )
4415           {
4416              /* Handle common case quickly: a is mapped, the entire word32 it
4417                 lives in is addressible. */
4418              // Convert full V-bits in register to compact 2-bit form.
4419              if (V_BITS8_DEFINED == vbits8) {
4420                 insert_vabits2_into_vabits8( a, VA_BITS2_DEFINED,
4421                                               &(sm->vabits8[sm_off]) );
4422              } else if (V_BITS8_UNDEFINED == vbits8) {
4423                 insert_vabits2_into_vabits8( a, VA_BITS2_UNDEFINED,
4424                                               &(sm->vabits8[sm_off]) );
4425              } else {
4426                 /* Slow but general case -- writing partially defined bytes. */
4427                 PROF_EVENT(272, "mc_STOREV8-slow2");
4428                 mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 8, (ULong)vbits8, False/*irrelevant*/ );
4429              }
4430           } else {
4431              /* Slow but general case. */
4432              PROF_EVENT(273, "mc_STOREV8-slow3");
4433              mc_STOREVn_slow( a, 8, (ULong)vbits8, False/*irrelevant*/ );
4434           }
4435        }
4436     #endif
4437     }

4499     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4500     /*--- Metadata get/set functions, for client requests.     ---*/
4501     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4502     
4503     // Nb: this expands the V+A bits out into register-form V bits, even though
4504     // they're in memory.  This is for backward compatibility, and because it's
4505     // probably what the user wants.
4506     
4507     /* Copy Vbits from/to address 'a'. Returns: 1 == OK, 2 == alignment
4508        error [no longer used], 3 == addressing error. */
4509     /* Nb: We used to issue various definedness/addressability errors from here,
4510        but we took them out because they ranged from not-very-helpful to
4511        downright annoying, and they complicated the error data structures. */
4512     static Int mc_get_or_set_vbits_for_client ( 
4513        Addr a, 
4514        Addr vbits, 
4515        SizeT szB, 
4516        Bool setting /* True <=> set vbits,  False <=> get vbits */ 
4517     )
4518     {
4519        SizeT i;
4520        Bool  ok;
4521        UChar vbits8;
4522     
4523        /* Check that arrays are addressible before doing any getting/setting. */
4524        for (i = 0; i < szB; i++) {
4525           if (VA_BITS2_NOACCESS == get_vabits2(a + i) ||
4526               VA_BITS2_NOACCESS == get_vabits2(vbits + i)) {
4527              return 3;
4528           }
4529        }
4530     
4531        /* Do the copy */
4532        if (setting) {
4533           /* setting */
4534           for (i = 0; i < szB; i++) {
4535              ok = set_vbits8(a + i, ((UChar*)vbits)[i]);
4536              tl_assert(ok);
4537           }
4538        } else {
4539           /* getting */
4540           for (i = 0; i < szB; i++) {
4541              ok = get_vbits8(a + i, &vbits8);
4542              tl_assert(ok);
4543              ((UChar*)vbits)[i] = vbits8;
4544           }
4545           // The bytes in vbits[] have now been set, so mark them as such.
4546           MC_(make_mem_defined)(vbits, szB);
4547        }
4548     
4549        return 1;
4550     }
4551     
4552     
4553     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4554     /*--- Detecting leaked (unreachable) malloc'd blocks.      ---*/
4555     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4556     
4557     /* For the memory leak detector, say whether an entire 64k chunk of
4558        address space is possibly in use, or not.  If in doubt return
4559        True.
4560     */
4561     Bool MC_(is_within_valid_secondary) ( Addr a )
4562     {
4563        SecMap* sm = maybe_get_secmap_for ( a );
4564        if (sm == NULL || sm == &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_NOACCESS]
4565            || MC_(in_ignored_range)(a)) {
4566           /* Definitely not in use. */
4567           return False;
4568        } else {
4569           return True;
4570        }
4571     }
4572     
4573     
4574     /* For the memory leak detector, say whether or not a given word
4575        address is to be regarded as valid. */
4576     Bool MC_(is_valid_aligned_word) ( Addr a )
4577     {
4578        tl_assert(sizeof(UWord) == 4 || sizeof(UWord) == 8);
4579        tl_assert(VG_IS_WORD_ALIGNED(a));
4580        if (is_mem_defined( a, sizeof(UWord), NULL, NULL) == MC_Ok
4581            && !MC_(in_ignored_range)(a)) {
4582           return True;
4583        } else {
4584           return False;
4585        }
4586     }

4589     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4590     /*--- Initialisation                                       ---*/
4591     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4592     
4593     static void init_shadow_memory ( void )
4594     {
4595        Int     i;
4596        SecMap* sm;
4597     
4598        tl_assert(V_BIT_UNDEFINED   == 1);
4599        tl_assert(V_BIT_DEFINED     == 0);
4600        tl_assert(V_BITS8_UNDEFINED == 0xFF);
4601        tl_assert(V_BITS8_DEFINED   == 0);
4602     
4603        /* Build the 3 distinguished secondaries */
4604        sm = &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_NOACCESS];
4605        for (i = 0; i < SM_CHUNKS; i++) sm->vabits8[i] = VA_BITS8_NOACCESS;
4606     
4607        sm = &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_UNDEFINED];
4608        for (i = 0; i < SM_CHUNKS; i++) sm->vabits8[i] = VA_BITS8_UNDEFINED;
4609     
4610        sm = &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_DEFINED];
4611        for (i = 0; i < SM_CHUNKS; i++) sm->vabits8[i] = VA_BITS8_DEFINED;
4612     
4613        /* Set up the primary map. */
4614        /* These entries gradually get overwritten as the used address
4615           space expands. */
4616        for (i = 0; i < N_PRIMARY_MAP; i++)
4617           primary_map[i] = &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_NOACCESS];
4618     
4619        /* Auxiliary primary maps */
4620        init_auxmap_L1_L2();
4621     
4622        /* auxmap_size = auxmap_used = 0; 
4623           no ... these are statically initialised */
4624     
4625        /* Secondary V bit table */
4626        secVBitTable = createSecVBitTable();
4627     }

4629     
4630     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4631     /*--- Sanity check machinery (permanently engaged)         ---*/
4632     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4633     
4634     static Bool mc_cheap_sanity_check ( void )
4635     {
4636        n_sanity_cheap++;
4637        PROF_EVENT(490, "cheap_sanity_check");
4638        /* Check for sane operating level */
4639        if (MC_(clo_mc_level) < 1 || MC_(clo_mc_level) > 3)
4640           return False;
4641        /* nothing else useful we can rapidly check */
4642        return True;
4643     }
4644     
4645     static Bool mc_expensive_sanity_check ( void )
4646     {
4647        Int     i;
4648        Word    n_secmaps_found;
4649        SecMap* sm;
4650        HChar*  errmsg;
4651        Bool    bad = False;
4652     
4653        if (0) VG_(printf)("expensive sanity check\n");
4654        if (0) return True;
4655     
4656        n_sanity_expensive++;
4657        PROF_EVENT(491, "expensive_sanity_check");
4658     
4659        /* Check for sane operating level */
4660        if (MC_(clo_mc_level) < 1 || MC_(clo_mc_level) > 3)
4661           return False;
4662     
4663        /* Check that the 3 distinguished SMs are still as they should be. */
4664     
4665        /* Check noaccess DSM. */
4666        sm = &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_NOACCESS];
4667        for (i = 0; i < SM_CHUNKS; i++)
4668           if (sm->vabits8[i] != VA_BITS8_NOACCESS)
4669              bad = True;
4670     
4671        /* Check undefined DSM. */
4672        sm = &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_UNDEFINED];
4673        for (i = 0; i < SM_CHUNKS; i++)
4674           if (sm->vabits8[i] != VA_BITS8_UNDEFINED)
4675              bad = True;
4676     
4677        /* Check defined DSM. */
4678        sm = &sm_distinguished[SM_DIST_DEFINED];
4679        for (i = 0; i < SM_CHUNKS; i++)
4680           if (sm->vabits8[i] != VA_BITS8_DEFINED)
4681              bad = True;
4682     
4683        if (bad) {
4684           VG_(printf)("memcheck expensive sanity: "
4685                       "distinguished_secondaries have changed\n");
4686           return False;
4687        }
4688     
4689        /* If we're not checking for undefined value errors, the secondary V bit
4690         * table should be empty. */
4691        if (MC_(clo_mc_level) == 1) {
4692           if (0 != VG_(OSetGen_Size)(secVBitTable))
4693              return False;
4694        }
4695     
4696        /* check the auxiliary maps, very thoroughly */
4697        n_secmaps_found = 0;
4698        errmsg = check_auxmap_L1_L2_sanity( &n_secmaps_found );
4699        if (errmsg) {
4700           VG_(printf)("memcheck expensive sanity, auxmaps:\n\t%s", errmsg);
4701           return False;
4702        }
4703     
4704        /* n_secmaps_found is now the number referred to by the auxiliary
4705           primary map.  Now add on the ones referred to by the main
4706           primary map. */
4707        for (i = 0; i < N_PRIMARY_MAP; i++) {
4708           if (primary_map[i] == NULL) {
4709              bad = True;
4710           } else {
4711              if (!is_distinguished_sm(primary_map[i]))
4712                 n_secmaps_found++;
4713           }
4714        }
4715     
4716        /* check that the number of secmaps issued matches the number that
4717           are reachable (iow, no secmap leaks) */
4718        if (n_secmaps_found != (n_issued_SMs - n_deissued_SMs))
4719           bad = True;
4720     
4721        if (bad) {
4722           VG_(printf)("memcheck expensive sanity: "
4723                       "apparent secmap leakage\n");
4724           return False;
4725        }
4726     
4727        if (bad) {
4728           VG_(printf)("memcheck expensive sanity: "
4729                       "auxmap covers wrong address space\n");
4730           return False;
4731        }
4732     
4733        /* there is only one pointer to each secmap (expensive) */
4734     
4735        return True;
4736     }
4737     
4738     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4739     /*--- Command line args                                    ---*/
4740     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4741     
4742     Bool          MC_(clo_partial_loads_ok)       = False;
4743     Long          MC_(clo_freelist_vol)           = 20*1000*1000LL;
4744     LeakCheckMode MC_(clo_leak_check)             = LC_Summary;
4745     VgRes         MC_(clo_leak_resolution)        = Vg_HighRes;
4746     Bool          MC_(clo_show_reachable)         = False;
4747     Bool          MC_(clo_show_possibly_lost)     = True;
4748     Bool          MC_(clo_workaround_gcc296_bugs) = False;
4749     Int           MC_(clo_malloc_fill)            = -1;
4750     Int           MC_(clo_free_fill)              = -1;
4751     Int           MC_(clo_mc_level)               = 2;
4752     
4753     static Bool mc_process_cmd_line_options(Char* arg)
4754     {
4755        Char* tmp_str;
4756     
4757        tl_assert( MC_(clo_mc_level) >= 1 && MC_(clo_mc_level) <= 3 );
4758     
4759        /* Set MC_(clo_mc_level):
4760              1 = A bit tracking only
4761              2 = A and V bit tracking, but no V bit origins
4762              3 = A and V bit tracking, and V bit origins
4763     
4764           Do this by inspecting --undef-value-errors= and
4765           --track-origins=.  Reject the case --undef-value-errors=no
4766           --track-origins=yes as meaningless.
4767        */
4768        if (0 == VG_(strcmp)(arg, "--undef-value-errors=no")) {
4769           if (MC_(clo_mc_level) == 3) {
4770              goto bad_level;
4771           } else {
4772              MC_(clo_mc_level) = 1;
4773              return True;
4774           }
4775        }
4776        if (0 == VG_(strcmp)(arg, "--undef-value-errors=yes")) {
4777           if (MC_(clo_mc_level) == 1)
4778              MC_(clo_mc_level) = 2;
4779           return True;
4780        }
4781        if (0 == VG_(strcmp)(arg, "--track-origins=no")) {
4782           if (MC_(clo_mc_level) == 3)
4783              MC_(clo_mc_level) = 2;
4784           return True;
4785        }
4786        if (0 == VG_(strcmp)(arg, "--track-origins=yes")) {
4787           if (MC_(clo_mc_level) == 1) {
4788              goto bad_level;
4789           } else {
4790              MC_(clo_mc_level) = 3;
4791              return True;
4792           }
4793        }
4794     
4795     	if VG_BOOL_CLO(arg, "--partial-loads-ok", MC_(clo_partial_loads_ok)) {}
4796        else if VG_BOOL_CLO(arg, "--show-reachable",   MC_(clo_show_reachable))   {}
4797        else if VG_BOOL_CLO(arg, "--show-possibly-lost",
4798                                                 MC_(clo_show_possibly_lost))     {}
4799        else if VG_BOOL_CLO(arg, "--workaround-gcc296-bugs",
4800                                                 MC_(clo_workaround_gcc296_bugs)) {}
4801     
4802        else if VG_BINT_CLO(arg, "--freelist-vol",  MC_(clo_freelist_vol), 
4803                                                    0, 10*1000*1000*1000LL) {}
4804        
4805        else if VG_XACT_CLO(arg, "--leak-check=no",
4806                                 MC_(clo_leak_check), LC_Off) {}
4807        else if VG_XACT_CLO(arg, "--leak-check=summary",
4808                                 MC_(clo_leak_check), LC_Summary) {}
4809        else if VG_XACT_CLO(arg, "--leak-check=yes",
4810                                 MC_(clo_leak_check), LC_Full) {}
4811        else if VG_XACT_CLO(arg, "--leak-check=full",
4812                                 MC_(clo_leak_check), LC_Full) {}
4813     
4814        else if VG_XACT_CLO(arg, "--leak-resolution=low",
4815                                 MC_(clo_leak_resolution), Vg_LowRes) {}
4816        else if VG_XACT_CLO(arg, "--leak-resolution=med",
4817                                 MC_(clo_leak_resolution), Vg_MedRes) {}
4818        else if VG_XACT_CLO(arg, "--leak-resolution=high",
4819                                 MC_(clo_leak_resolution), Vg_HighRes) {}
4820     
4821        else if VG_STR_CLO(arg, "--ignore-ranges", tmp_str) {
4822           Int  i;
4823           Bool ok  = parse_ignore_ranges(tmp_str);
4824           if (!ok)
4825             return False;
4826           tl_assert(ignoreRanges.used >= 0);
4827           tl_assert(ignoreRanges.used < M_IGNORE_RANGES);
4828           for (i = 0; i < ignoreRanges.used; i++) {
4829              Addr s = ignoreRanges.start[i];
4830              Addr e = ignoreRanges.end[i];
4831              Addr limit = 0x4000000; /* 64M - entirely arbitrary limit */
4832              if (e <= s) {
4833                 VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg, 
4834                    "ERROR: --ignore-ranges: end <= start in range:\n");
4835                 VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg, 
4836                    "       0x%lx-0x%lx\n", s, e);
4837                 return False;
4838              }
4839              if (e - s > limit) {
4840                 VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg, 
4841                    "ERROR: --ignore-ranges: suspiciously large range:\n");
4842                 VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg, 
4843                    "       0x%lx-0x%lx (size %ld)\n", s, e, (UWord)(e-s));
4844                 return False;
4845     	 }
4846           }
4847        }
4848     
4849        else if VG_BHEX_CLO(arg, "--malloc-fill", MC_(clo_malloc_fill), 0x00,0xFF) {}
4850        else if VG_BHEX_CLO(arg, "--free-fill",   MC_(clo_free_fill),   0x00,0xFF) {}
4851     
4852        else
4853           return VG_(replacement_malloc_process_cmd_line_option)(arg);
4854     
4855        return True;
4856     
4857     
4858       bad_level:
4859        VG_(fmsg_bad_option)(arg,
4860           "--track-origins=yes has no effect when --undef-value-errors=no.\n");
4861     }
4862     
4863     static void mc_print_usage(void)
4864     {  
4865        VG_(printf)(
4866     "    --leak-check=no|summary|full     search for memory leaks at exit?  [summary]\n"
4867     "    --leak-resolution=low|med|high   differentiation of leak stack traces [high]\n"
4868     "    --show-reachable=no|yes          show reachable blocks in leak check? [no]\n"
4869     "    --show-possibly-lost=no|yes      show possibly lost blocks in leak check?\n"
4870     "                                     [yes]\n"
4871     "    --undef-value-errors=no|yes      check for undefined value errors [yes]\n"
4872     "    --track-origins=no|yes           show origins of undefined values? [no]\n"
4873     "    --partial-loads-ok=no|yes        too hard to explain here; see manual [no]\n"
4874     "    --freelist-vol=<number>          volume of freed blocks queue [20000000]\n"
4875     "    --workaround-gcc296-bugs=no|yes  self explanatory [no]\n"
4876     "    --ignore-ranges=0xPP-0xQQ[,0xRR-0xSS]   assume given addresses are OK\n"
4877     "    --malloc-fill=<hexnumber>        fill malloc'd areas with given value\n"
4878     "    --free-fill=<hexnumber>          fill free'd areas with given value\n"
4879        );
4880     }
4881     
4882     static void mc_print_debug_usage(void)
4883     {  
4884        VG_(printf)(
4885     "    (none)\n"
4886        );
4887     }

4889     
4890     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4891     /*--- Client blocks                                        ---*/
4892     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4893     
4894     /* Client block management:
4895       
4896        This is managed as an expanding array of client block descriptors.
4897        Indices of live descriptors are issued to the client, so it can ask
4898        to free them later.  Therefore we cannot slide live entries down
4899        over dead ones.  Instead we must use free/inuse flags and scan for
4900        an empty slot at allocation time.  This in turn means allocation is
4901        relatively expensive, so we hope this does not happen too often. 
4902     
4903        An unused block has start == size == 0
4904     */
4905     
4906     /* type CGenBlock is defined in mc_include.h */
4907     
4908     /* This subsystem is self-initialising. */
4909     static UWord      cgb_size = 0;
4910     static UWord      cgb_used = 0;
4911     static CGenBlock* cgbs     = NULL;
4912     
4913     /* Stats for this subsystem. */
4914     static ULong cgb_used_MAX = 0;   /* Max in use. */
4915     static ULong cgb_allocs   = 0;   /* Number of allocs. */
4916     static ULong cgb_discards = 0;   /* Number of discards. */
4917     static ULong cgb_search   = 0;   /* Number of searches. */
4918     
4919     
4920     /* Get access to the client block array. */
4921     void MC_(get_ClientBlock_array)( /*OUT*/CGenBlock** blocks,
4922                                      /*OUT*/UWord* nBlocks )
4923     {
4924        *blocks  = cgbs;
4925        *nBlocks = cgb_used;
4926     }
4927     
4928     
4929     static
4930     Int alloc_client_block ( void )
4931     {
4932        UWord      i, sz_new;
4933        CGenBlock* cgbs_new;
4934     
4935        cgb_allocs++;
4936     
4937        for (i = 0; i < cgb_used; i++) {
4938           cgb_search++;
4939           if (cgbs[i].start == 0 && cgbs[i].size == 0)
4940              return i;
4941        }
4942     
4943        /* Not found.  Try to allocate one at the end. */
4944        if (cgb_used < cgb_size) {
4945           cgb_used++;
4946           return cgb_used-1;
4947        }
4948     
4949        /* Ok, we have to allocate a new one. */
4950        tl_assert(cgb_used == cgb_size);
4951        sz_new = (cgbs == NULL) ? 10 : (2 * cgb_size);
4952     
4953        cgbs_new = VG_(malloc)( "mc.acb.1", sz_new * sizeof(CGenBlock) );
4954        for (i = 0; i < cgb_used; i++) 
4955           cgbs_new[i] = cgbs[i];
4956     
4957        if (cgbs != NULL)
4958           VG_(free)( cgbs );
4959        cgbs = cgbs_new;
4960     
4961        cgb_size = sz_new;
4962        cgb_used++;
4963        if (cgb_used > cgb_used_MAX)
4964           cgb_used_MAX = cgb_used;
4965        return cgb_used-1;
4966     }
4967     
4968     
4969     static void show_client_block_stats ( void )
4970     {
4971        VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg, 
4972           "general CBs: %llu allocs, %llu discards, %llu maxinuse, %llu search\n",
4973           cgb_allocs, cgb_discards, cgb_used_MAX, cgb_search 
4974        );
4975     }
4976     
4977     
4978     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4979     /*--- Client requests                                      ---*/
4980     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
4981     
4982     static Bool mc_handle_client_request ( ThreadId tid, UWord* arg, UWord* ret )
4983     {
4984        Int   i;
4985        Bool  ok;
4986        Addr  bad_addr;
4987     
4988        if (!VG_IS_TOOL_USERREQ('M','C',arg[0])
4989            && VG_USERREQ__MALLOCLIKE_BLOCK != arg[0]
4990            && VG_USERREQ__RESIZEINPLACE_BLOCK != arg[0]
4991            && VG_USERREQ__FREELIKE_BLOCK   != arg[0]
4992            && VG_USERREQ__CREATE_MEMPOOL   != arg[0]
4993            && VG_USERREQ__DESTROY_MEMPOOL  != arg[0]
4994            && VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_ALLOC    != arg[0]
4995            && VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_FREE     != arg[0]
4996            && VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_TRIM     != arg[0]
4997            && VG_USERREQ__MOVE_MEMPOOL     != arg[0]
4998            && VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_CHANGE   != arg[0]
4999            && VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_EXISTS   != arg[0])
5000           return False;
5001     
5002        switch (arg[0]) {
5003           case VG_USERREQ__CHECK_MEM_IS_ADDRESSABLE:
5004              ok = is_mem_addressable ( arg[1], arg[2], &bad_addr );
5005              if (!ok)
5006                 MC_(record_user_error) ( tid, bad_addr, /*isAddrErr*/True, 0 );
5007              *ret = ok ? (UWord)NULL : bad_addr;
5008              break;
5009     
5010           case VG_USERREQ__CHECK_MEM_IS_DEFINED: {
5011              MC_ReadResult res;
5012              UInt otag = 0;
5013              res = is_mem_defined ( arg[1], arg[2], &bad_addr, &otag );
5014              if (MC_AddrErr == res)
5015                 MC_(record_user_error) ( tid, bad_addr, /*isAddrErr*/True, 0 );
5016              else if (MC_ValueErr == res)
5017                 MC_(record_user_error) ( tid, bad_addr, /*isAddrErr*/False, otag );
5018              *ret = ( res==MC_Ok ? (UWord)NULL : bad_addr );
5019              break;
5020           }
5021     
5022           case VG_USERREQ__DO_LEAK_CHECK:
5023              MC_(detect_memory_leaks)(tid, arg[1] ? LC_Summary : LC_Full);
5024              *ret = 0; /* return value is meaningless */
5025              break;
5026     
5027           case VG_USERREQ__MAKE_MEM_NOACCESS:
5028              MC_(make_mem_noaccess) ( arg[1], arg[2] );
5029              *ret = -1;
5030              break;
5031     
5032           case VG_USERREQ__MAKE_MEM_UNDEFINED:
5033              make_mem_undefined_w_tid_and_okind ( arg[1], arg[2], tid, 
5034                                                   MC_OKIND_USER );
5035              *ret = -1;
5036              break;
5037     
5038           case VG_USERREQ__MAKE_MEM_DEFINED:
5039              MC_(make_mem_defined) ( arg[1], arg[2] );
5040              *ret = -1;
5041              break;
5042     
5043           case VG_USERREQ__MAKE_MEM_DEFINED_IF_ADDRESSABLE:
5044              make_mem_defined_if_addressable ( arg[1], arg[2] );
5045              *ret = -1;
5046              break;
5047     
5048           case VG_USERREQ__CREATE_BLOCK: /* describe a block */
5049              if (arg[1] != 0 && arg[2] != 0) {
5050                 i = alloc_client_block();
5051                 /* VG_(printf)("allocated %d %p\n", i, cgbs); */
5052                 cgbs[i].start = arg[1];
5053                 cgbs[i].size  = arg[2];
5054                 cgbs[i].desc  = VG_(strdup)("mc.mhcr.1", (Char *)arg[3]);
5055                 cgbs[i].where = VG_(record_ExeContext) ( tid, 0/*first_ip_delta*/ );
5056                 *ret = i;
5057              } else
5058                 *ret = -1;
5059              break;
5060     
5061           case VG_USERREQ__DISCARD: /* discard */
5062              if (cgbs == NULL 
5063                  || arg[2] >= cgb_used ||
5064                  (cgbs[arg[2]].start == 0 && cgbs[arg[2]].size == 0)) {
5065                 *ret = 1;
5066              } else {
5067                 tl_assert(arg[2] >= 0 && arg[2] < cgb_used);
5068                 cgbs[arg[2]].start = cgbs[arg[2]].size = 0;
5069                 VG_(free)(cgbs[arg[2]].desc);
5070                 cgb_discards++;
5071                 *ret = 0;
5072              }
5073              break;
5074     
5075           case VG_USERREQ__GET_VBITS:
5076              *ret = mc_get_or_set_vbits_for_client
5077                        ( arg[1], arg[2], arg[3], False /* get them */ );
5078              break;
5079     
5080           case VG_USERREQ__SET_VBITS:
5081              *ret = mc_get_or_set_vbits_for_client
5082                        ( arg[1], arg[2], arg[3], True /* set them */ );
5083              break;
5084     
5085           case VG_USERREQ__COUNT_LEAKS: { /* count leaked bytes */
5086              UWord** argp = (UWord**)arg;
5087              // MC_(bytes_leaked) et al were set by the last leak check (or zero
5088              // if no prior leak checks performed).
5089              *argp[1] = MC_(bytes_leaked) + MC_(bytes_indirect);
5090              *argp[2] = MC_(bytes_dubious);
5091              *argp[3] = MC_(bytes_reachable);
5092              *argp[4] = MC_(bytes_suppressed);
5093              // there is no argp[5]
5094              //*argp[5] = MC_(bytes_indirect);
5095              // XXX need to make *argp[1-4] defined;  currently done in the
5096              // VALGRIND_COUNT_LEAKS_MACRO by initialising them to zero.
5097              *ret = 0;
5098              return True;
5099           }
5100           case VG_USERREQ__COUNT_LEAK_BLOCKS: { /* count leaked blocks */
5101              UWord** argp = (UWord**)arg;
5102              // MC_(blocks_leaked) et al were set by the last leak check (or zero
5103              // if no prior leak checks performed).
5104              *argp[1] = MC_(blocks_leaked) + MC_(blocks_indirect);
5105              *argp[2] = MC_(blocks_dubious);
5106              *argp[3] = MC_(blocks_reachable);
5107              *argp[4] = MC_(blocks_suppressed);
5108              // there is no argp[5]
5109              //*argp[5] = MC_(blocks_indirect);
5110              // XXX need to make *argp[1-4] defined;  currently done in the
5111              // VALGRIND_COUNT_LEAK_BLOCKS_MACRO by initialising them to zero.
5112              *ret = 0;
5113              return True;
5114           }
5115           case VG_USERREQ__MALLOCLIKE_BLOCK: {
5116              Addr p         = (Addr)arg[1];
5117              SizeT sizeB    =       arg[2];
5118              //UInt rzB       =       arg[3];    XXX: unused!
5119              Bool is_zeroed = (Bool)arg[4];
5120     
5121              MC_(new_block) ( tid, p, sizeB, /*ignored*/0, is_zeroed, 
5122                               MC_AllocCustom, MC_(malloc_list) );
5123              return True;
5124           }
5125           case VG_USERREQ__RESIZEINPLACE_BLOCK: {
5126              Addr p         = (Addr)arg[1];
5127              SizeT oldSizeB =       arg[2];
5128              SizeT newSizeB =       arg[3];
5129              UInt rzB       =       arg[4];
5130     
5131              MC_(handle_resizeInPlace) ( tid, p, oldSizeB, newSizeB, rzB );
5132              return True;
5133           }
5134           case VG_USERREQ__FREELIKE_BLOCK: {
5135              Addr p         = (Addr)arg[1];
5136              UInt rzB       =       arg[2];
5137     
5138              MC_(handle_free) ( tid, p, rzB, MC_AllocCustom );
5139              return True;
5140           }
5141     
5142           case _VG_USERREQ__MEMCHECK_RECORD_OVERLAP_ERROR: {
5143              Char* s   = (Char*)arg[1];
5144              Addr  dst = (Addr) arg[2];
5145              Addr  src = (Addr) arg[3];
5146              SizeT len = (SizeT)arg[4];
5147              MC_(record_overlap_error)(tid, s, src, dst, len);
5148              return True;
5149           }
5150     
5151           case VG_USERREQ__CREATE_MEMPOOL: {
5152              Addr pool      = (Addr)arg[1];
5153              UInt rzB       =       arg[2];
5154              Bool is_zeroed = (Bool)arg[3];
5155     
5156              MC_(create_mempool) ( pool, rzB, is_zeroed );
5157              return True;
5158           }
5159     
5160           case VG_USERREQ__DESTROY_MEMPOOL: {
5161              Addr pool      = (Addr)arg[1];
5162     
5163              MC_(destroy_mempool) ( pool );
5164              return True;
5165           }
5166     
5167           case VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_ALLOC: {
5168              Addr pool      = (Addr)arg[1];
5169              Addr addr      = (Addr)arg[2];
5170              UInt size      =       arg[3];
5171     
5172              MC_(mempool_alloc) ( tid, pool, addr, size );
5173              return True;
5174           }
5175     
5176           case VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_FREE: {
5177              Addr pool      = (Addr)arg[1];
5178              Addr addr      = (Addr)arg[2];
5179     
5180              MC_(mempool_free) ( pool, addr );
5181              return True;
5182           }
5183     
5184           case VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_TRIM: {
5185              Addr pool      = (Addr)arg[1];
5186              Addr addr      = (Addr)arg[2];
5187              UInt size      =       arg[3];
5188     
5189              MC_(mempool_trim) ( pool, addr, size );
5190              return True;
5191           }
5192     
5193           case VG_USERREQ__MOVE_MEMPOOL: {
5194              Addr poolA     = (Addr)arg[1];
5195              Addr poolB     = (Addr)arg[2];
5196     
5197              MC_(move_mempool) ( poolA, poolB );
5198              return True;
5199           }
5200     
5201           case VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_CHANGE: {
5202              Addr pool      = (Addr)arg[1];
5203              Addr addrA     = (Addr)arg[2];
5204              Addr addrB     = (Addr)arg[3];
5205              UInt size      =       arg[4];
5206     
5207              MC_(mempool_change) ( pool, addrA, addrB, size );
5208              return True;
5209           }
5210     
5211           case VG_USERREQ__MEMPOOL_EXISTS: {
5212              Addr pool      = (Addr)arg[1];
5213     
5214              *ret = (UWord) MC_(mempool_exists) ( pool );
5215     	 return True;
5216           }
5217     
5218     
5219           default:
5220              VG_(message)(
5221                 Vg_UserMsg, 
5222                 "Warning: unknown memcheck client request code %llx\n",
5223                 (ULong)arg[0]
5224              );
5225              return False;
5226        }
5227        return True;
5228     }

5234     
5235     // We track a number of interesting events (using PROF_EVENT)
5236     // if MC_PROFILE_MEMORY is defined.
5237     
5238     #ifdef MC_PROFILE_MEMORY
5239     
5240     UInt   MC_(event_ctr)[N_PROF_EVENTS];
5241     HChar* MC_(event_ctr_name)[N_PROF_EVENTS];
5242     
5243     static void init_prof_mem ( void )
5244     {
5245        Int i;
5246        for (i = 0; i < N_PROF_EVENTS; i++) {
5247           MC_(event_ctr)[i] = 0;
5248           MC_(event_ctr_name)[i] = NULL;
5249        }
5250     }
5251     
5252     static void done_prof_mem ( void )
5253     {
5254        Int  i;
5255        Bool spaced = False;
5256        for (i = 0; i < N_PROF_EVENTS; i++) {
5257           if (!spaced && (i % 10) == 0) {
5258              VG_(printf)("\n");
5259              spaced = True;
5260           }
5261           if (MC_(event_ctr)[i] > 0) {
5262              spaced = False;
5263              VG_(printf)( "prof mem event %3d: %9d   %s\n", 
5264                           i, MC_(event_ctr)[i],
5265                           MC_(event_ctr_name)[i] 
5266                              ? MC_(event_ctr_name)[i] : "unnamed");
5267           }
5268        }
5269     }
5270     
5271     #else
5272     
5273     static void init_prof_mem ( void ) { }
5274     static void done_prof_mem ( void ) { }
5275     
5276     #endif

5279     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
5280     /*--- Origin tracking stuff                                ---*/
5281     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
5282     
5283     /*--------------------------------------------*/
5284     /*--- Origin tracking: load handlers       ---*/
5285     /*--------------------------------------------*/
5286     
5287     static INLINE UInt merge_origins ( UInt or1, UInt or2 ) {
5288        return or1 > or2 ? or1 : or2;
5289     }
5290     
5291     UWord VG_REGPARM(1) MC_(helperc_b_load1)( Addr a ) {
5292        OCacheLine* line;
5293        UChar descr;
5294        UWord lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5295        UWord byteoff = a & 3; /* 0, 1, 2 or 3 */
5296     
5297        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5298           tl_assert(lineoff >= 0 && lineoff < OC_W32S_PER_LINE);
5299        }
5300     
5301        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5302     
5303        descr = line->descr[lineoff];
5304        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5305           tl_assert(descr < 0x10);
5306        }
5307     
5308        if (LIKELY(0 == (descr & (1 << byteoff))))  {
5309           return 0;
5310        } else {
5311           return line->w32[lineoff];
5312        }
5313     }
5314     
5315     UWord VG_REGPARM(1) MC_(helperc_b_load2)( Addr a ) {
5316        OCacheLine* line;
5317        UChar descr;
5318        UWord lineoff, byteoff;
5319     
5320        if (UNLIKELY(a & 1)) {
5321           /* Handle misaligned case, slowly. */
5322           UInt oLo   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load1)( a + 0 );
5323           UInt oHi   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load1)( a + 1 );
5324           return merge_origins(oLo, oHi);
5325        }
5326     
5327        lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5328        byteoff = a & 3; /* 0 or 2 */
5329     
5330        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5331           tl_assert(lineoff >= 0 && lineoff < OC_W32S_PER_LINE);
5332        }
5333        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5334     
5335        descr = line->descr[lineoff];
5336        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5337           tl_assert(descr < 0x10);
5338        }
5339     
5340        if (LIKELY(0 == (descr & (3 << byteoff)))) {
5341           return 0;
5342        } else {
5343           return line->w32[lineoff];
5344        }
5345     }
5346     
5347     UWord VG_REGPARM(1) MC_(helperc_b_load4)( Addr a ) {
5348        OCacheLine* line;
5349        UChar descr;
5350        UWord lineoff;
5351     
5352        if (UNLIKELY(a & 3)) {
5353           /* Handle misaligned case, slowly. */
5354           UInt oLo   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load2)( a + 0 );
5355           UInt oHi   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load2)( a + 2 );
5356           return merge_origins(oLo, oHi);
5357        }
5358     
5359        lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5360        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5361           tl_assert(lineoff >= 0 && lineoff < OC_W32S_PER_LINE);
5362        }
5363     
5364        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5365     
5366        descr = line->descr[lineoff];
5367        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5368           tl_assert(descr < 0x10);
5369        }
5370     
5371        if (LIKELY(0 == descr)) {
5372           return 0;
5373        } else {
5374           return line->w32[lineoff];
5375        }
5376     }
5377     
5378     UWord VG_REGPARM(1) MC_(helperc_b_load8)( Addr a ) {
5379        OCacheLine* line;
5380        UChar descrLo, descrHi, descr;
5381        UWord lineoff;
5382     
5383        if (UNLIKELY(a & 7)) {
5384           /* Handle misaligned case, slowly. */
5385           UInt oLo   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load4)( a + 0 );
5386           UInt oHi   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load4)( a + 4 );
5387           return merge_origins(oLo, oHi);
5388        }
5389     
5390        lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5391        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5392           tl_assert(lineoff == (lineoff & 6)); /*0,2,4,6*//*since 8-aligned*/
5393        }
5394     
5395        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5396     
5397        descrLo = line->descr[lineoff + 0];
5398        descrHi = line->descr[lineoff + 1];
5399        descr   = descrLo | descrHi;
5400        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5401           tl_assert(descr < 0x10);
5402        }
5403     
5404        if (LIKELY(0 == descr)) {
5405           return 0; /* both 32-bit chunks are defined */
5406        } else {
5407           UInt oLo = descrLo == 0 ? 0 : line->w32[lineoff + 0];
5408           UInt oHi = descrHi == 0 ? 0 : line->w32[lineoff + 1];
5409           return merge_origins(oLo, oHi);
5410        }
5411     }
5412     
5413     UWord VG_REGPARM(1) MC_(helperc_b_load16)( Addr a ) {
5414        UInt oLo   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load8)( a + 0 );
5415        UInt oHi   = (UInt)MC_(helperc_b_load8)( a + 8 );
5416        UInt oBoth = merge_origins(oLo, oHi);
5417        return (UWord)oBoth;
5418     }
5419     
5420     
5421     /*--------------------------------------------*/
5422     /*--- Origin tracking: store handlers      ---*/
5423     /*--------------------------------------------*/
5424     
5425     void VG_REGPARM(2) MC_(helperc_b_store1)( Addr a, UWord d32 ) {
5426        OCacheLine* line;
5427        UWord lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5428        UWord byteoff = a & 3; /* 0, 1, 2 or 3 */
5429     
5430        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5431           tl_assert(lineoff >= 0 && lineoff < OC_W32S_PER_LINE);
5432        }
5433     
5434        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5435     
5436        if (d32 == 0) {
5437           line->descr[lineoff] &= ~(1 << byteoff);
5438        } else {
5439           line->descr[lineoff] |= (1 << byteoff);
5440           line->w32[lineoff] = d32;
5441        }
5442     }
5443     
5444     void VG_REGPARM(2) MC_(helperc_b_store2)( Addr a, UWord d32 ) {
5445        OCacheLine* line;
5446        UWord lineoff, byteoff;
5447     
5448        if (UNLIKELY(a & 1)) {
5449           /* Handle misaligned case, slowly. */
5450           MC_(helperc_b_store1)( a + 0, d32 );
5451           MC_(helperc_b_store1)( a + 1, d32 );
5452           return;
5453        }
5454     
5455        lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5456        byteoff = a & 3; /* 0 or 2 */
5457     
5458        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5459           tl_assert(lineoff >= 0 && lineoff < OC_W32S_PER_LINE);
5460        }
5461     
5462        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5463     
5464        if (d32 == 0) {
5465           line->descr[lineoff] &= ~(3 << byteoff);
5466        } else {
5467           line->descr[lineoff] |= (3 << byteoff);
5468           line->w32[lineoff] = d32;
5469        }
5470     }
5471     
5472     void VG_REGPARM(2) MC_(helperc_b_store4)( Addr a, UWord d32 ) {
5473        OCacheLine* line;
5474        UWord lineoff;
5475     
5476        if (UNLIKELY(a & 3)) {
5477           /* Handle misaligned case, slowly. */
5478           MC_(helperc_b_store2)( a + 0, d32 );
5479           MC_(helperc_b_store2)( a + 2, d32 );
5480           return;
5481        }
5482     
5483        lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5484        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5485           tl_assert(lineoff >= 0 && lineoff < OC_W32S_PER_LINE);
5486        }
5487     
5488        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5489     
5490        if (d32 == 0) {
5491           line->descr[lineoff] = 0;
5492        } else {
5493           line->descr[lineoff] = 0xF;
5494           line->w32[lineoff] = d32;
5495        }
5496     }
5497     
5498     void VG_REGPARM(2) MC_(helperc_b_store8)( Addr a, UWord d32 ) {
5499        OCacheLine* line;
5500        UWord lineoff;
5501     
5502        if (UNLIKELY(a & 7)) {
5503           /* Handle misaligned case, slowly. */
5504           MC_(helperc_b_store4)( a + 0, d32 );
5505           MC_(helperc_b_store4)( a + 4, d32 );
5506           return;
5507        }
5508     
5509        lineoff = oc_line_offset(a);
5510        if (OC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) {
5511           tl_assert(lineoff == (lineoff & 6)); /*0,2,4,6*//*since 8-aligned*/
5512        }
5513     
5514        line = find_OCacheLine( a );
5515     
5516        if (d32 == 0) {
5517           line->descr[lineoff + 0] = 0;
5518           line->descr[lineoff + 1] = 0;
5519        } else {
5520           line->descr[lineoff + 0] = 0xF;
5521           line->descr[lineoff + 1] = 0xF;
5522           line->w32[lineoff + 0] = d32;
5523           line->w32[lineoff + 1] = d32;
5524        }
5525     }
5526     
5527     void VG_REGPARM(2) MC_(helperc_b_store16)( Addr a, UWord d32 ) {
5528        MC_(helperc_b_store8)( a + 0, d32 );
5529        MC_(helperc_b_store8)( a + 8, d32 );
5530     }
5531     
5532     
5533     /*--------------------------------------------*/
5534     /*--- Origin tracking: sarp handlers       ---*/
5535     /*--------------------------------------------*/
5536     
5537     __attribute__((noinline))
5538     static void ocache_sarp_Set_Origins ( Addr a, UWord len, UInt otag ) {
5539        if ((a & 1) && len >= 1) {
5540           MC_(helperc_b_store1)( a, otag );
5541           a++;
5542           len--;
5543        }
5544        if ((a & 2) && len >= 2) {
5545           MC_(helperc_b_store2)( a, otag );
5546           a += 2;
5547           len -= 2;
5548        }
5549        if (len >= 4) 
5550           tl_assert(0 == (a & 3));
5551        while (len >= 4) {
5552           MC_(helperc_b_store4)( a, otag );
5553           a += 4;
5554           len -= 4;
5555        }
5556        if (len >= 2) {
5557           MC_(helperc_b_store2)( a, otag );
5558           a += 2;
5559           len -= 2;
5560        }
5561        if (len >= 1) {
5562           MC_(helperc_b_store1)( a, otag );
5563           //a++;
5564           len--;
5565        }
5566        tl_assert(len == 0);
5567     }
5568     
5569     __attribute__((noinline))
5570     static void ocache_sarp_Clear_Origins ( Addr a, UWord len ) {
5571        if ((a & 1) && len >= 1) {
5572           MC_(helperc_b_store1)( a, 0 );
5573           a++;
5574           len--;
5575        }
5576        if ((a & 2) && len >= 2) {
5577           MC_(helperc_b_store2)( a, 0 );
5578           a += 2;
5579           len -= 2;
5580        }
5581        if (len >= 4) 
5582           tl_assert(0 == (a & 3));
5583        while (len >= 4) {
5584           MC_(helperc_b_store4)( a, 0 );
5585           a += 4;
5586           len -= 4;
5587        }
5588        if (len >= 2) {
5589           MC_(helperc_b_store2)( a, 0 );
5590           a += 2;
5591           len -= 2;
5592        }
5593        if (len >= 1) {
5594           MC_(helperc_b_store1)( a, 0 );
5595           //a++;
5596           len--;
5597        }
5598        tl_assert(len == 0);
5599     }
5600     
5601     
5602     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
5603     /*--- Setup and finalisation                               ---*/
5604     /*------------------------------------------------------------*/
5605     
5606     static void mc_post_clo_init ( void )
5607     {
5608        /* If we've been asked to emit XML, mash around various other
5609           options so as to constrain the output somewhat. */
5610        if (VG_(clo_xml)) {
5611           /* Extract as much info as possible from the leak checker. */
5612           /* MC_(clo_show_reachable) = True; */
5613           MC_(clo_leak_check) = LC_Full;
5614        }
5615     
5616        tl_assert( MC_(clo_mc_level) >= 1 && MC_(clo_mc_level) <= 3 );
5617     
5618        if (MC_(clo_mc_level) == 3) {
5619           /* We're doing origin tracking. */
5620     #     ifdef PERF_FAST_STACK
5621           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_4_w_ECU)   ( mc_new_mem_stack_4_w_ECU   );
5622           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_8_w_ECU)   ( mc_new_mem_stack_8_w_ECU   );
5623           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_12_w_ECU)  ( mc_new_mem_stack_12_w_ECU  );
5624           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_16_w_ECU)  ( mc_new_mem_stack_16_w_ECU  );
5625           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_32_w_ECU)  ( mc_new_mem_stack_32_w_ECU  );
5626           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_112_w_ECU) ( mc_new_mem_stack_112_w_ECU );
5627           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_128_w_ECU) ( mc_new_mem_stack_128_w_ECU );
5628           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_144_w_ECU) ( mc_new_mem_stack_144_w_ECU );
5629           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_160_w_ECU) ( mc_new_mem_stack_160_w_ECU );
5630     #     endif
5631           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_w_ECU)     ( mc_new_mem_stack_w_ECU     );
5632        } else {
5633           /* Not doing origin tracking */
5634     #     ifdef PERF_FAST_STACK
5635           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_4)   ( mc_new_mem_stack_4   );
5636           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_8)   ( mc_new_mem_stack_8   );
5637           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_12)  ( mc_new_mem_stack_12  );
5638           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_16)  ( mc_new_mem_stack_16  );
5639           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_32)  ( mc_new_mem_stack_32  );
5640           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_112) ( mc_new_mem_stack_112 );
5641           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_128) ( mc_new_mem_stack_128 );
5642           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_144) ( mc_new_mem_stack_144 );
5643           VG_(track_new_mem_stack_160) ( mc_new_mem_stack_160 );
5644     #     endif
5645           VG_(track_new_mem_stack)     ( mc_new_mem_stack     );
5646        }
5647     
5648        /* This origin tracking cache is huge (~100M), so only initialise
5649           if we need it. */
5650        if (MC_(clo_mc_level) >= 3) {
5651           init_OCache();
5652           tl_assert(ocacheL1 != NULL);
5653           tl_assert(ocacheL2 != NULL);
5654        } else {
5655           tl_assert(ocacheL1 == NULL);
5656           tl_assert(ocacheL2 == NULL);
5657        }
5658     }
5659     
5660     static void print_SM_info(char* type, int n_SMs)
5661     {
5662        VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5663           " memcheck: SMs: %s = %d (%ldk, %ldM)\n",
5664           type,
5665           n_SMs,
5666           n_SMs * sizeof(SecMap) / 1024UL,
5667           n_SMs * sizeof(SecMap) / (1024 * 1024UL) );
5668     }
5669     
5670     static void mc_fini ( Int exitcode )
5671     {
5672        MC_(print_malloc_stats)();
5673     
5674        if (MC_(clo_leak_check) != LC_Off) {
5675           MC_(detect_memory_leaks)(1/*bogus ThreadId*/, MC_(clo_leak_check));
5676        } else {
5677           if (VG_(clo_verbosity) == 1 && !VG_(clo_xml)) {
5678              VG_(umsg)(
5679                 "For a detailed leak analysis, rerun with: --leak-check=full\n"
5680                 "\n"
5681              );
5682           }
5683        }
5684     
5685        if (VG_(clo_verbosity) == 1 && !VG_(clo_xml)) {
5686           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, 
5687                        "For counts of detected and suppressed errors, rerun with: -v\n");
5688        }
5689     
5690        if (MC_(any_value_errors) && !VG_(clo_xml) && VG_(clo_verbosity) >= 1
5691            && MC_(clo_mc_level) == 2) {
5692           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg,
5693                        "Use --track-origins=yes to see where "
5694                        "uninitialised values come from\n");
5695        }
5696     
5697        done_prof_mem();
5698     
5699        if (VG_(clo_stats)) {
5700           SizeT max_secVBit_szB, max_SMs_szB, max_shmem_szB;
5701           
5702           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5703              " memcheck: sanity checks: %d cheap, %d expensive\n",
5704              n_sanity_cheap, n_sanity_expensive );
5705           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5706              " memcheck: auxmaps: %lld auxmap entries (%lldk, %lldM) in use\n",
5707              n_auxmap_L2_nodes, 
5708              n_auxmap_L2_nodes * 64, 
5709              n_auxmap_L2_nodes / 16 );
5710           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5711              " memcheck: auxmaps_L1: %lld searches, %lld cmps, ratio %lld:10\n",
5712              n_auxmap_L1_searches, n_auxmap_L1_cmps,
5713              (10ULL * n_auxmap_L1_cmps) 
5714                 / (n_auxmap_L1_searches ? n_auxmap_L1_searches : 1) 
5715           );   
5716           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5717              " memcheck: auxmaps_L2: %lld searches, %lld nodes\n",
5718              n_auxmap_L2_searches, n_auxmap_L2_nodes
5719           );   
5720     
5721           print_SM_info("n_issued     ", n_issued_SMs);
5722           print_SM_info("n_deissued   ", n_deissued_SMs);
5723           print_SM_info("max_noaccess ", max_noaccess_SMs);
5724           print_SM_info("max_undefined", max_undefined_SMs);
5725           print_SM_info("max_defined  ", max_defined_SMs);
5726           print_SM_info("max_non_DSM  ", max_non_DSM_SMs);
5727     
5728           // Three DSMs, plus the non-DSM ones
5729           max_SMs_szB = (3 + max_non_DSM_SMs) * sizeof(SecMap);
5730           // The 3*sizeof(Word) bytes is the AVL node metadata size.
5731           // The 4*sizeof(Word) bytes is the malloc metadata size.
5732           // Hardwiring these sizes in sucks, but I don't see how else to do it.
5733           max_secVBit_szB = max_secVBit_nodes * 
5734                 (sizeof(SecVBitNode) + 3*sizeof(Word) + 4*sizeof(Word));
5735           max_shmem_szB   = sizeof(primary_map) + max_SMs_szB + max_secVBit_szB;
5736     
5737           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5738              " memcheck: max sec V bit nodes:    %d (%ldk, %ldM)\n",
5739              max_secVBit_nodes, max_secVBit_szB / 1024,
5740                                 max_secVBit_szB / (1024 * 1024));
5741           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5742              " memcheck: set_sec_vbits8 calls: %llu (new: %llu, updates: %llu)\n",
5743              sec_vbits_new_nodes + sec_vbits_updates,
5744              sec_vbits_new_nodes, sec_vbits_updates );
5745           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5746              " memcheck: max shadow mem size:   %ldk, %ldM\n",
5747              max_shmem_szB / 1024, max_shmem_szB / (1024 * 1024));
5748     
5749           if (MC_(clo_mc_level) >= 3) {
5750              VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5751                           " ocacheL1: %'12lu refs   %'12lu misses (%'lu lossage)\n",
5752                           stats_ocacheL1_find, 
5753                           stats_ocacheL1_misses,
5754                           stats_ocacheL1_lossage );
5755              VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5756                           " ocacheL1: %'12lu at 0   %'12lu at 1\n",
5757                           stats_ocacheL1_find - stats_ocacheL1_misses 
5758                              - stats_ocacheL1_found_at_1 
5759                              - stats_ocacheL1_found_at_N,
5760                           stats_ocacheL1_found_at_1 );
5761              VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5762                           " ocacheL1: %'12lu at 2+  %'12lu move-fwds\n",
5763                           stats_ocacheL1_found_at_N,
5764                           stats_ocacheL1_movefwds );
5765              VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5766                           " ocacheL1: %'12lu sizeB  %'12u useful\n",
5767                           (UWord)sizeof(OCache),
5768                           4 * OC_W32S_PER_LINE * OC_LINES_PER_SET * OC_N_SETS );
5769              VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5770                           " ocacheL2: %'12lu refs   %'12lu misses\n",
5771                           stats__ocacheL2_refs, 
5772                           stats__ocacheL2_misses );
5773              VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5774                           " ocacheL2:    %'9lu max nodes %'9lu curr nodes\n",
5775                           stats__ocacheL2_n_nodes_max,
5776                           stats__ocacheL2_n_nodes );
5777              VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5778                           " niacache: %'12lu refs   %'12lu misses\n",
5779                           stats__nia_cache_queries, stats__nia_cache_misses);
5780           } else {
5781              tl_assert(ocacheL1 == NULL);
5782              tl_assert(ocacheL2 == NULL);
5783           }
5784        }
5785     
5786        if (0) {
5787           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg, 
5788             "------ Valgrind's client block stats follow ---------------\n" );
5789           show_client_block_stats();
5790        }
5791     }
5792     
5793     static void mc_pre_clo_init(void)
5794     {
5795        VG_(details_name)            ("Memcheck");
5796        VG_(details_version)         (NULL);
5797        VG_(details_description)     ("a memory error detector");
5798        VG_(details_copyright_author)(
5799           "Copyright (C) 2002-2010, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.");
5800        VG_(details_bug_reports_to)  (VG_BUGS_TO);
5801        VG_(details_avg_translation_sizeB) ( 640 );
5802     
5803        VG_(basic_tool_funcs)          (mc_post_clo_init,
5804                                        MC_(instrument),
5805                                        mc_fini);
5806     
5807        VG_(needs_final_IR_tidy_pass)  ( MC_(final_tidy) );
5808     
5809     
5810        VG_(needs_core_errors)         ();
5811        VG_(needs_tool_errors)         (MC_(eq_Error),
5812                                        MC_(before_pp_Error),
5813                                        MC_(pp_Error),
5814                                        True,/*show TIDs for errors*/
5815                                        MC_(update_Error_extra),
5816                                        MC_(is_recognised_suppression),
5817                                        MC_(read_extra_suppression_info),
5818                                        MC_(error_matches_suppression),
5819                                        MC_(get_error_name),
5820                                        MC_(get_extra_suppression_info));
5821        VG_(needs_libc_freeres)        ();
5822        VG_(needs_command_line_options)(mc_process_cmd_line_options,
5823                                        mc_print_usage,
5824                                        mc_print_debug_usage);
5825        VG_(needs_client_requests)     (mc_handle_client_request);
5826        VG_(needs_sanity_checks)       (mc_cheap_sanity_check,
5827                                        mc_expensive_sanity_check);
5828        VG_(needs_malloc_replacement)  (MC_(malloc),
5829                                        MC_(__builtin_new),
5830                                        MC_(__builtin_vec_new),
5831                                        MC_(memalign),
5832                                        MC_(calloc),
5833                                        MC_(free),
5834                                        MC_(__builtin_delete),
5835                                        MC_(__builtin_vec_delete),
5836                                        MC_(realloc),
5837                                        MC_(malloc_usable_size), 
5838                                        MC_MALLOC_REDZONE_SZB );
5839     
5840        VG_(needs_xml_output)          ();
5841     
5842        VG_(track_new_mem_startup)     ( mc_new_mem_startup );
5843        VG_(track_new_mem_stack_signal)( make_mem_undefined_w_tid );
5844        // We assume that brk()/sbrk() does not initialise new memory.  Is this
5845        // accurate?  John Reiser says:
5846        //
5847        //   0) sbrk() can *decrease* process address space.  No zero fill is done
5848        //   for a decrease, not even the fragment on the high end of the last page
5849        //   that is beyond the new highest address.  For maximum safety and
5850        //   portability, then the bytes in the last page that reside above [the
5851        //   new] sbrk(0) should be considered to be uninitialized, but in practice
5852        //   it is exceedingly likely that they will retain their previous
5853        //   contents.
5854        //
5855        //   1) If an increase is large enough to require new whole pages, then
5856        //   those new whole pages (like all new pages) are zero-filled by the
5857        //   operating system.  So if sbrk(0) already is page aligned, then
5858        //   sbrk(PAGE_SIZE) *does* zero-fill the new memory.
5859        //
5860        //   2) Any increase that lies within an existing allocated page is not
5861        //   changed.  So if (x = sbrk(0)) is not page aligned, then
5862        //   sbrk(PAGE_SIZE) yields ((PAGE_SIZE -1) & -x) bytes which keep their
5863        //   existing contents, and an additional PAGE_SIZE bytes which are zeroed.
5864        //   ((PAGE_SIZE -1) & x) of them are "covered" by the sbrk(), and the rest
5865        //   of them come along for the ride because the operating system deals
5866        //   only in whole pages.  Again, for maximum safety and portability, then
5867        //   anything that lives above [the new] sbrk(0) should be considered
5868        //   uninitialized, but in practice will retain previous contents [zero in
5869        //   this case.]"
5870        //
5871        // In short: 
5872        //
5873        //   A key property of sbrk/brk is that new whole pages that are supplied
5874        //   by the operating system *do* get initialized to zero.
5875        //
5876        // As for the portability of all this:
5877        //
5878        //   sbrk and brk are not POSIX.  However, any system that is a derivative
5879        //   of *nix has sbrk and brk because there are too many softwares (such as
5880        //   the Bourne shell) which rely on the traditional memory map (.text,
5881        //   .data+.bss, stack) and the existence of sbrk/brk.
5882        //
5883        // So we should arguably observe all this.  However:
5884        // - The current inaccuracy has caused maybe one complaint in seven years(?)
5885        // - Relying on the zeroed-ness of whole brk'd pages is pretty grotty... I
5886        //   doubt most programmers know the above information.
5887        // So I'm not terribly unhappy with marking it as undefined. --njn.
5888        //
5889        // [More:  I think most of what John said only applies to sbrk().  It seems
5890        // that brk() always deals in whole pages.  And since this event deals
5891        // directly with brk(), not with sbrk(), perhaps it would be reasonable to
5892        // just mark all memory it allocates as defined.]
5893        //
5894        VG_(track_new_mem_brk)         ( make_mem_undefined_w_tid );
5895     
5896        // Handling of mmap and mprotect isn't simple (well, it is simple,
5897        // but the justification isn't.)  See comments above, just prior to
5898        // mc_new_mem_mmap.
5899        VG_(track_new_mem_mmap)        ( mc_new_mem_mmap );
5900        VG_(track_change_mem_mprotect) ( mc_new_mem_mprotect );
5901        
5902        VG_(track_copy_mem_remap)      ( MC_(copy_address_range_state) );
5903     
5904        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_signal)( MC_(make_mem_noaccess) ); 
5905        VG_(track_die_mem_brk)         ( MC_(make_mem_noaccess) );
5906        VG_(track_die_mem_munmap)      ( MC_(make_mem_noaccess) ); 
5907     
5908        /* Defer the specification of the new_mem_stack functions to the
5909           post_clo_init function, since we need to first parse the command
5910           line before deciding which set to use. */
5911     
5912     #  ifdef PERF_FAST_STACK
5913        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_4)     ( mc_die_mem_stack_4   );
5914        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_8)     ( mc_die_mem_stack_8   );
5915        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_12)    ( mc_die_mem_stack_12  );
5916        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_16)    ( mc_die_mem_stack_16  );
5917        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_32)    ( mc_die_mem_stack_32  );
5918        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_112)   ( mc_die_mem_stack_112 );
5919        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_128)   ( mc_die_mem_stack_128 );
5920        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_144)   ( mc_die_mem_stack_144 );
5921        VG_(track_die_mem_stack_160)   ( mc_die_mem_stack_160 );
5922     #  endif
5923        VG_(track_die_mem_stack)       ( mc_die_mem_stack     );
5924        
5925        VG_(track_ban_mem_stack)       ( MC_(make_mem_noaccess) );
5926     
5927        VG_(track_pre_mem_read)        ( check_mem_is_defined );
5928        VG_(track_pre_mem_read_asciiz) ( check_mem_is_defined_asciiz );
5929        VG_(track_pre_mem_write)       ( check_mem_is_addressable );
5930        VG_(track_post_mem_write)      ( mc_post_mem_write );
5931     
5932        if (MC_(clo_mc_level) >= 2)
5933           VG_(track_pre_reg_read)     ( mc_pre_reg_read );
5934     
5935        VG_(track_post_reg_write)                  ( mc_post_reg_write );
5936        VG_(track_post_reg_write_clientcall_return)( mc_post_reg_write_clientcall );
5937     
5938        init_shadow_memory();
5939        MC_(malloc_list)  = VG_(HT_construct)( "MC_(malloc_list)" );
5940        MC_(mempool_list) = VG_(HT_construct)( "MC_(mempool_list)" );
5941        init_prof_mem();
5942     
5943        tl_assert( mc_expensive_sanity_check() );
5944     
5945        // {LOADV,STOREV}[8421] will all fail horribly if this isn't true.
5946        tl_assert(sizeof(UWord) == sizeof(Addr));
5947        // Call me paranoid.  I don't care.
5948        tl_assert(sizeof(void*) == sizeof(Addr));
5949     
5950        // BYTES_PER_SEC_VBIT_NODE must be a power of two.
5951        tl_assert(-1 != VG_(log2)(BYTES_PER_SEC_VBIT_NODE));
5952     
5953        /* This is small.  Always initialise it. */
5954        init_nia_to_ecu_cache();
5955     
5956        /* We can't initialise ocacheL1/ocacheL2 yet, since we don't know
5957           if we need to, since the command line args haven't been
5958           processed yet.  Hence defer it to mc_post_clo_init. */
5959        tl_assert(ocacheL1 == NULL);
5960        tl_assert(ocacheL2 == NULL);
5961     
5962        /* Check some important stuff.  See extensive comments above
5963           re UNALIGNED_OR_HIGH for background. */
5964     #  if VG_WORDSIZE == 4
5965        tl_assert(sizeof(void*) == 4);
5966        tl_assert(sizeof(Addr)  == 4);
5967        tl_assert(sizeof(UWord) == 4);
5968        tl_assert(sizeof(Word)  == 4);
5969        tl_assert(MAX_PRIMARY_ADDRESS == 0xFFFFFFFFUL);
5970        tl_assert(MASK(1) == 0UL);
5971        tl_assert(MASK(2) == 1UL);
5972        tl_assert(MASK(4) == 3UL);
5973        tl_assert(MASK(8) == 7UL);
5974     #  else
5975        tl_assert(VG_WORDSIZE == 8);
5976        tl_assert(sizeof(void*) == 8);
5977        tl_assert(sizeof(Addr)  == 8);
5978        tl_assert(sizeof(UWord) == 8);
5979        tl_assert(sizeof(Word)  == 8);
5980        tl_assert(MAX_PRIMARY_ADDRESS == 0x7FFFFFFFFULL);
5981        tl_assert(MASK(1) == 0xFFFFFFF800000000ULL);
5982        tl_assert(MASK(2) == 0xFFFFFFF800000001ULL);
5983        tl_assert(MASK(4) == 0xFFFFFFF800000003ULL);
5984        tl_assert(MASK(8) == 0xFFFFFFF800000007ULL);
5985     #  endif
5986     }
5987     
5988     VG_DETERMINE_INTERFACE_VERSION(mc_pre_clo_init)
5989     
5990     /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5991     /*--- end                                                mc_main.c ---*/
